arm_group.description: Oral or nasal endotracheal intubation, anticipated to last at least 48 hours Adults that require ETT internal diameter sizes of 6.5 - 9.0 mm Subject must be at least 18 years old (no upper age limitation) English speaking patients/decision makers.

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the ability of the SonarMed AirWave to provide clinicians with information that
      enables them to confirm continuous proper placement of the endotracheal tube.  This initial
      study is prospective, observational, looking at CXR results, and comparing those to AirWave
      system output data.

clinical_study.brief_title: Novel Device to Assess Endotracheal Tube Migration
clinical_study.condition: Mechanically Ventilated Patients Admitted to a Medical Intensive Care Unit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria

        Subjects will be eligible for inclusion in the study if they meet ALL of the following
        criteria:

          -  Oral or nasal endotracheal intubation, anticipated to last at least 48 hours

          -  Adults that require ETT internal diameter sizes of 6.5 - 9.0 mm

          -  Subject must be at least 18 years old (no upper age limitation)

          -  English speaking patients/decision makers.

        Exclusion Criteria

          -  Subjects ventilated through a tracheostomy

          -  Subjects under 18 years of age

clinical_study.official_title: Novel Device (AirWave™) to Assess Endotracheal Tube Migration.

primary_outcome.description:
Use of the AirWave in the study group to calculate ETT tip distance from the carina will demonstrate a strong positive correlation with chest x-rays results.  Specific endpoints will include:
• Compare CXR tube tip movement/distance to carina measurement results to AirWave tube tip movement/distance to carina calculation results (from the AirWave baseline location) within 24 hours after intubation.
primary_outcome.measure: Endotracheal tube displacement measured by a novel device (AirWave)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
